measured_by: loss-aversion parameter λ (in CPT utility function)
justification: The article states that “when parameter λ is larger than 1… loss aversion… Parameter λ attempts to capture behavioral gain-loss asymmetries,” showing λ is the numeric indicator of the construct.

measured_by: probability-sensitivity parameter γ (in CPT probability-weighting function)
justification: It notes that w(p)=p^γ… where “γ is a probability sensitivity parameter,” so γ operationalises how probabilities are psychologically weighted.
The text explains u(x)=x^α for gains and that values of α between 0 and 1 make the function concave, capturing risk aversion, identifying α as the measure of this curvature.
For losses u(x)=−λ|x|^β and the article says β<1 makes the function convex, so β indexes the curvature of subjective value for losses.

measured_by: attention-transfer parameter δ in TAX model
justification: Within TAX, “parameter δ determines the direction and magnitude of the transfer” of attention weights, directly quantifying the postulated attention-exchange construct.

measured_by: sampling proportion parameter π in DFT-e model
justification: DFT-e assumes that “with probability π the individual succeeds in sampling the events proportionally,” hence π measures the tendency toward proportional vs. non-proportional sampling.

measured_by: attention-weight parameter τ in DFT-e model
justification: The manuscript introduces τ as “an attention-weight parameter… that biases sampling… between gains and losses,” making τ the quantitative measure of this bias.

measured_by: choice-sensitivity parameter θ in logistic choice rule
justification: Equation (6) defines choice probability with “choice-sensitivity parameter θ,” which “modulates how much choice probabilities change,” thus θ indexes the construct of choice noise/sensitivity.
